bin.jl

In this file there are all the useful functions that should be used to read a bin potree.

Thoose functions are tested but in order to be fully functional they need to be revised.

!BUG

in fact the function decodePoint decodes everything as suggested at hte end of pointDecoding but every bin file has a different bounding box instead bin2points passes to the decoder the bounding box of the cloud. Sometimes the resultant points are the same but as the Potree grows the points change their coordinates significally.

Here's an example using the stair potree stored in the potree folder: As you can see the circled parts differ.

By the way that's a minor issue because this "bug" could be fixed in various way. In this package there's also a test file that helps to check wheter further changes resolve the problem.

ToDo

  • Fix the decoding
  • Parse RGB to LasIO.N0f16
  • As the previous points are fixed just create a trie with the previous infos

Main Interface

Potree.decodePoint — Function
function decodePoint(point::Int32, scale::Float32, boundingBoxMin::Float32) -> Float32

decodes a point of a bin file (https://github.com/PropellerAero/potree-propeller-private/blob/master/docs/file_format.md )

source
Potree.binToPointsUgly — Function

binToPointsUgly(fname::String) -> nothing

First version of decoder doesn't return nothing. It just shows the decoded points and Binary code for rgba

source
Potree.bin2points — Function

bin2points(fname::String) -> Array{Float64,2}(undef, 3, 0)

Returns every point of the passed bin file.

source
Potree.bin2rgb — Function

bin2rgb(fname::String) -> {LasIO.N0f16,2}(undef, 3, 0)

(BUGGED RETURN) TODO: parse rgba to LasIO.N0f16 "Should" return rgb(a) values of every point of the bin file.

source
Potree.bin2pointcloud — Function

bin2pointcloud(source::String) -> Array{Float64,2}(undef, 3, 0)

TODO: check bin2rgbs Returns a PointCloud without Point and Cloud... It's just an array of points
